title: i getting REALLY sick of blantant matchmaking working against you in promos
body: had to try hella hard to get into gold 3, wanna take a peak at my last team? because we had 3 fucking silvers while the enemy had 2 plats and the rest high gold, that match was 100% against me from the very fucking start its a miracle i won that match thank god i camped bot, fun other fact the enemy jg? last season diamond ofc, in my promos, giving me a mostly silver team to get to gold 3 with, what a joke

replies.body:
It sounds like you had some rough games there. Looking at the match too, you did super well to help carry your team to victory and definitely deserved the win.

Many players have already said this in comments but what I do want to mention here is that many players use third-party sites to psych themselves out before a game even begins. Visual rankings are *NOT* 1 to 1 to MMR, which is what matchmaking looks at when creating a team. The system is never actually against you. It works to try to match you with and against players so that you have as close as a 50/50 chance of winning every game, including promos.

Looking at the stats for the game (might be a little off since some have played games since then), the match was fair and even on both sides. The system actually matched that game with your team having a higher % to win.

I want to share this because matchmaking is always a frequent inquiry we get in support where players feel it is unfair but the system works as it is intended to.

Thanks for the reply Keyru! I think you've actually highlighted what frustrates many players (myself included!).  It's that visual rankings don't really show how good you are but most players believe it is the proof of how well someone plays.

MMR being hidden causes us to only have the visual ranks to look at. This also causes an issue where, lets say 2 players should actually be at gold 1 and are currently at silver 4. One may find  their way to gold 1 fairly easy while the other actually struggles to get there. After enough games, they should both be at gold 1.

The problem being that, before that end point, both players skills are perceived as different and this can cause some anguish for the player that takes longer to get to gold 1. They might even stop playing.

If MMR was visible, or even some stat that said "you're playing at a gold 1 level" might help players understand that they just need to play more for their visible ranking to match up to what their actual calculated is.

That or get rid of the best of 3/5 promos as it just seems to add a grind and frustration. Id be more in favor of this than anything else

I tend to agree too from the Player POV. There are frustrations behind the hidden numbers and I've been trying to think from the Player Support perspective, what _can_ we do to clarify this better on the player end to understand the system more with how it's intended to be. The scope then moves away from changing the system (mmr visibility, removing promos, etc) to perception/understanding. That is the space that I work with.

Just put it in private on your profile what Your MMR rank is. That way you can know if you are improving or not. 

You can also give the "standard" or average MMR of different Ranks so you can see where you at in terms of if the system thinks you belong there or not.
They won't do that cause then you can post hard proof that their system malfunctions. That's the point of keeping data hidden.

> The system is never actually against you. It works to try to match you with and against players so that you have as close as a 50/50 chance of winning every game, including promos.

I hardly doubt it.
We should have mainly fair matches, and only a minor number of one-sided games, as in a normal/gaussian distribution.

What actually happens is exactly the opposite, ie. one-sided games are the majority. Pretty easy to check looking at people's match histories, streams, and so on; you can consider Silver to Diamond elos to avoid "extreme" cases (absolute randomness in very low elos; the same bunch of people playing over and over in the very high ones).
Just in case, this is often evident since the very first minutes, before snoballing effects can actually become relevant.

Moreover, you find VERY easy games in **too many** cases, and after a while VERY hard games in **too many** cases as well. There is **NO gradualness**, and this is the main crucial point where you can see things are not as you said.

So what?
Well, you still get an overall 50% win-ratio, but it's MUCH more controllable, and make players play a lot more to get to their deserved elo. I don't think it's a coincidence or just a matter of very bad coding.

I don’t know why anyone is even bothering with this. Everyone knows the system is seriously flawed for both ranks and match making.  Everyone knows riot doesn’t care enough to fix it.

It doesn’t have to be a lot,  3-5k prestige but we should never see a 0 prestige champion being used in ranked play.  Also under certain situations if you are under punishment for things like afk or inting you should also be banned from ranked play. Riot would need to step up and actually looking at reports and determining if punishment is justified or not.  (Note dodging allowing a remake or redraft is not Afking)
